Package pages

package pages
The pages package contains all the JavaFX-based user interface (UI) components of the application.

Each class in this package typically corresponds to a specific scene in the application. These pages are composed using JavaFX layout managers, controls, and styles, and they handle event-driven logic for user interactions.

Key Functional Areas:

  • Authentication and Account Management
    • @link pages.UserLoginPage – Main login screen for users to access the platform.
    • @link pages.SignUpPage – Allows new users to register and create an account.
    • @link pages.SetupAccountPage – Guides users through initial account setup post-registration.
    • @link pages.UpdateAccountPage – Enables users to edit their profile and credentials.
    • @link pages.ResetPasswordPage – Provides password reset functionality via secure prompts.
    • @link pages.SetupLoginSelectionPage, @link RoleSelectionPage, @link WelcomeLoginPage – Assist with login method, role selection, and redirection to appropriate entry points.
  • Home Pages
    • AdminHomePage, InstructorHomePage – Home dashboards tailored to specific user roles.
    • FirstPage, InitialAccessPage – Landing pages shown after login or first use.
  • Question and Answer Management
    • @link pages.EditQuestionPage, @link pages.EditAnswerPage – Interfaces for editing submitted QA content.
    • @link pages.MyPostsPage, @link pages.MyQAPage – Personal views of questions or answers authored by the user.
    • @link pages.SearchPage, @link pages.SearchAsPage – Provide advanced question/answer search features.
  • Reviewing System
    • ReviewPage – Displays reviews for questions/answers.
    • EditReviewPage – Page for editing previously written reviews.
    • TrustedReviewersPage – Interface for assigning or managing trusted reviewers.
  • Messaging System
    • MessagingPage – Core messaging interface for user communication and clarifications.
  • User Profiles
    • ProfilePage – View and manage a user's public profile.

The classes in this package coordinate directly with the model, logic, and databasePart1 layers to fetch data, trigger logic, and reflect user actions. Most pages follow a pattern of initializing UI controls, loading dynamic content on scene display, and defining button or event handlers inline.

  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    AdminHomePage
    AdminHomePage represents the admin interface.
    AdminSetupPage
     
    AnnouncementPopup
    Announcement Popup with dynamic per-card dismissal (fade out + remove)

    AnswersPage
    AnswersPage UI: shows answers for a question, allows submitting, editing, deleting
    EditAnswerPage
    The EditAnswerPage class allows users to edit their answers.
    EditQuestionPage
    The EditQuestionPage class allows users to edit their questions.
    EditReviewPage
    The EditReviewPage class allows users to edit their reviews.
    FAQPage
    FAQPage - UI page that displays frequently asked questions grouped by category.
    FirstPage
    FirstPage class represents the initial screen for the first user.
    InitialAccessPage
    InitialAccessPage builds and shows the initial access UI used for login, sign-up and password reset flows.
    InstructorHomePage
    The InstructorHomePage class represents the home page for instructors.
    InvitationPage
    InvitePage class represents the page where an admin can generate an invitation code.

    The MyQAPage class displays questions created by the logged-in user.

    ReviewPage
    ReviewPage - shows either: - "My Reviews" (show(stage,user)) OR - "Reviews for a selected Answer" (showForAnswer(stage,user,answer))
    RoleSelectionPage
    RoleSelectionPage lets users choose which role to act as if they have multiple.

    TrustedReviewersPage.TrustedReviewerRow
     
    UpdateAccountPage
    UpdateAccountPage class handles the account information update/change process for established users.

    The WelcomeLoginPage class displays a welcome screen for authenticated users.
